Posts.Content: Hiya, most therapists, can do a light massage on you, they cant do deep tissue massage, if you could change it for a reflexology, you would love that, thats allowed works on the feet for an hour and the benifits last all week, fantastic, makes you feel like a new woman as my mother keeps saying reiki also is allowed, go on to alternate therapies and check for forself we have to be good to our selves cause we are worth it, iv got stobo castle booked for august cant wait, they are protecting themselves for health and safety policy for thier insurance... enjoy whatever you get done regards janie.xx

Posts.Title: Severe joint pain following chemo. Please help.

Posts.Content: HI sally, to be honest your hair is coming out sooner rather than later, it's a relief once it's out because you move on, wigs i love them, i have 7 all different lengths colours styles, You will get your free one go to the stockists that they tell you, my advice is to go for a multi-tonel one that has a few highlights in it that means, the style is up to you but choppy miranda is one of my favourites and loads of my friends have tried it and it seems to suit all face shapes if you dont have a definate style to start from, when you lose all your hair the wig is too big for you so they take out a weft to make it fit you, now you can ask to keep the weft or wefts that they take out so you can use them, wait for it for a fringe, place under a hat or scarf and it softens the look and people aren't sure if you have hair or not great wee trick , and gives you more looks. I have bought loads of wigs on the internet, ebay have loads china takes a bit to arrive a lot cheaper than you think but worth waiting for ,ask away if you need anymore info, i finished fec in november and my hair in coming in fast and furious ok so its grey at the sides i dont care, i love the fact when you go in the bath it's not cold on the back of the head he he good luck on your journey, any question dont worry big or small someone will help........
Posts.Title: Scalp cooling with FEC 75

Posts.Content: Hiya hannah, just to let you know i had my wle and total nodes clearence done on the 6th jan unfortunatly there was another satalite in the healthy tissue, went back on the 18th jan they also did a bit liposuction from thighs and midriff which was sorer that the other operation and bruises wow, and today got total clear results, i had chemo, first finished in nov, i go back to see oncology consultant on thurs to chat about radio therapy, i also got a perscription for tamoxifen to start taking,  but that rollercoaster that we are on we seem to get through it bit by bit, i start rad in march 4 weeks and thats me for a year before i have to return i cant believe the journey we are on but if it works im well up for it and i have found a couple of travel insurance which will insure us that were set up by cancer patients for cancer patients pink insure.com and insurewith.com.. holiday to look forward too im going to book soon.. thats if i can shift a stone in weight, joining the gym and when i feel ready, joining the zumba nation again...baby steps thats what i was told so looking forward to the new me.....Be strong and everyone on here is rooting for you always there when and if you need us, fingerscrossed its a good scan. janie x

Posts.Content: It just that you might have had a few rougue cells that were too small to be detected, but its a good thing they are on top of it and they are doing the best thing, checking rather than leaving it to a check up later. be positive you have a great team behind you, its in your interest...some cells are stuborn critters i had a lumpectomy with no clear margin so i had another one still a few grew, back on chemo again we will get the critters no doubt about it...be positive i am.. started yesterday side effects not kicked in yet yipee....x they have to be over a certain size to be detected....they can only take out what they can see...
